title: Matt Lucas defends David Walliams against Piers Morgan after BGT comments
text:
Matt stood up for his long-time friend (Picture: ITV/REX)

Matt Lucas has defended David Walliams against Piers Morgan after the Good Morning Britain host compared him to a ‘sniveling toad.’

It’s all getting a bit personal.

Piers took aim at David after he appeared to like the ‘nastiest comments’ about him online but apparently was overly friendly to his face.

Resharing a post that David had apparently liked on Twitter, he commented: ‘Amusing that ⁦@davidwalliams⁩ regularly ‘likes’ the nastiest tweets about me, yet is such a snivelling toady to my face.

‘It’s not my fault ⁦@BGT⁩ ratings were so much higher when I was in your chair Dave!’

However, Matt wasn’t having any of it.

Matt wasn’t standing for Piers’ brutal comments (Picture: Twitter)

‘Purely objectively – 1) He was probably being polite. Some people are,’ he wrote.

‘2) Boasting about the BGT ratings and popularity when you were briefly on it to someone who has not only transformed the show but is consistently the biggest-selling author in the country didn’t work.’

‘Hi Matt, I don’t think it’s ‘polite’ to be friendly to people in person but poisonous behind their back – it’s cowardly,’ Piers responded.

‘As for BGT, I was very proudly on it for the first 4 years when ratings topped 20 million. They’re now half that. Not a boast, just a fact.’

It seemed the Little Britain star wasn’t in the mood for a night-time internet argument as he urged the presenter: ‘Go to bed.’

He wasn’t in the mood for a night-time internet argument (Picture: Twitter)

However, Piers went in for the last word as he told Matt: ‘Fight your own battles. You certainly fought one with him long enough.’

It’s no secret that Matt and David were at odds for a few years during their careers together.

They first fell out in 2005 during their Little Britain Live Tour, with Matt revealing in his autobiography that they were ‘often at loggerheads’ over minor issues.

The two eventually stopped speaking in 2011, the same year Come Fly With Me was broadcast.

Matt and David stopped talking in 2010 but have since put their differences aside (Picture: Jon Furniss/WireImage)

However, the duo have since made amends, delighting fans as they posted snaps of themselves reuniting.

Piers was a judge on Britain’s Got Talent for the first four series, alongside Simon Cowell and Amanda Holden.

While Michael McIntyre and David Hasselhoff stepped in for series five, from series six onwards, the judging panel had a revamp, featuring Alesha Dixon and David.

Meanwhile, Piers has faced a huge amount of backlash in the past few days, after a poll on Good Morning Britain, which asked viewers whether or not he should be removed from the show, appeared to backfire in a big way.

The final results of the poll, which has more than 400,000 votes, show 60% voting for him to leave.

However, he doesn’t seem too bothered by the whole affair, after gloating on the show that it had led to a pay rise for him.

‘Let me tell you what you’ve done, you’ve helped me get a pay rise,’ he said. ‘So, cheers. Cheers everybody.’

Metro.co.uk has contacted ITV and reps for David for comment.
description: Matt Lucas defends Little Britain co-star David Walliams against Good Morning Britain's Piers Morgan after Britain's Got Talent comments.
